attributes.description: A look inside what it took to get such a simple yet "smartphone" such as the Samsung Galaxy SIII out to its worldwide consumers.
attributes.title: Samsung Galaxy SIII

attributes.description: The Samsung Galaxy at my door step.
attributes.title: Stephen Mohan

attributes.description: T-Mobile International AG is a holding company for Deutsche Telekom AG's various mobile communications subsidiaries outside Germany.  They are a huge mobile phone operator, and also part of the Open Handset Alliance.
attributes.title: T-Mobile International AG

attributes.description: An American multinational computer technology corporation that develops, sells, repairs and supports computers and related products and services. Also, involved with the Andriod Platforms with Open Handset Alliance
attributes.title: Dell Inc.

attributes.description: A Japanese multinational conglomerate corporation headquartered in Kōnan Minato, Tokyo, Japan. Its diversified business is primarily focused on the electronics, game, entertainment and financial services industries. Also, part of the Open Handset Alliance in the development of the Android Platforms.
attributes.title: Sony Corporation

attributes.description: High Tech Computer Corporation, is a Taiwanese manufacturer of smartphones and tablets. That is part of Open Handset Alliance in developing the Android platform.
attributes.title: HTC Corporation

attributes.description: American multinational corporation that provides Internet-related products and services, including internet search, cloud computing, software and advertising technologies. Google is the biggest contender when it comes to the Open Handset Alliance and the Andriod platform itself.
attributes.title: Google Inc.

attributes.description: A consortium of big players in the electronic and telecom industries.  This Company is responsible for creating the Android platform base on majority of smartphones with the exception of the IPhone.  To name a few key players that developed the company and platforms for the smartphones would be Google, HTC, Sony, Dell, Intel, Motorola, Qualcomm, Texas Instruments, Samsung Electronics, LG Electronics, T-Mobile, Sprint Nextel, Nvidia, etc.  There are 84 + companies onboard this alliance.
attributes.title: Open Handset Alliance

attributes.description: This is Samsung's Manufacturing plant for most electronic items. The Galaxy SIII gets most of its components manufactured for its phone in-house. As well, the assembly of the phones are done at this plant.
attributes.title: Samsung Electronics MFG. LTD

attributes.description: Corning Taiwan is a subsidiary of Corning Incorporated, also known as Corning Glass Works till 1989.  They are a manufacturer of glass and ceramics.  Corning developed what they call a Gorilla glass, engineered with a combination of thinness, lightness, and damage-resistance, it is used primarily as the cover glass for portable electronic devices such as mobile phones, tablets, etc.
attributes.title: Corning Taiwan

attributes.description:
Samsung Electronics is the flagship subsidiary of Samsung Group.  This is where some of the manufacturing takes place for Samsung. And all the research & development is done here for all there electronic products for consumer use. Samsung Electronics is a huge electronics company that branches off into 4 major industries : Consumer Electronics, Telecoms Equipment, Semi-Conductors & Home Appliances.  They tend to do things on the grander scale than majority of its electronic competitors. It currently holds many titles such as world's largest information technology company, mobile phone maker, television manufacturer, LCD panels just to name a few. They are also, one of many corporations involved in the development of the Andriod platforms 

The battery and memory card gets made here in South Korea. Then get shipped off to china for the main phone to be manufactured and assemled.
attributes.title: Samsung Electronics
Qualcomm Inc.
attributes.description: An American global semiconductor company that designs, manufactures and markets digital wireless telecommunications products and services. 1 of 84 companies involved in the creation of the Andriod platforms.

attributes.title: Texas Instruments Inc.
attributes.description: an American company that designs and makes semiconductors, which it sells to electronics designers and manufacturers globally. Also, another company that is involved behind the development of the Andriod platform.

attributes.title: LG Electronics
attributes.description: South Korean multinational electronics company the flagship subsidiary of the LG Group. The company operates its business through five divisions: Mobile Communications, Home Entertainment, Home Appliances, Air Conditioning, and Energy Solutions. Also, another key player in the Andriod platforms.
